supporting_text: The NAP reflects the opinions and views of experts and key stakeholders working in the fields of human health, animal health, agriculture, and food production in Iran.
Objective 1: Raise public awareness and promote the trainings and educations for professional groups includes specific actions in the human health sector.
Objective 4: Promote the appropriate use of antimicrobial drugs in the fields of healthcare, livestock production, and poultry farming, aquaculture includes specific actions targeting animal health.
The NAP includes strategies for monitoring and evaluating antimicrobial resistance in the environment as part of the integrated health care system.

Objective 3: Prevent the spread of microorganisms resistant to antimicrobial drugs via implementing appropriate control and prevention programs includes actions related to agriculture and food security.
The NAP outlines the need for annual reports on the progress of the action plan.
The NAP includes specific outcome indicators for tracking progress, such as reducing resistance levels by 2021.
The NAP specifies targets such as reducing the resistance of specific bacteria to certain antibiotics by 2021.
The document does not mention specific budget allocations for the strategies or actions.
There is no assessment of future budget requirements mentioned in the document.
The NAP mentions the establishment of a Microbial Resistance National Committee to adopt policies and monitor activities.
The NAP includes actions to formulate new practical laws and regulations for the prevention and control of infections and antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP includes actions to integrate educational activities in the field of antimicrobial resistance for specific groups, including professionals.
The NAP includes actions to promote public awareness through media and community engagement.
The NAP promotes international collaboration for conducting research on antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP includes strategies for strengthening the antimicrobial resistance surveillance system in health care centers.
The NAP emphasizes the need for a robust surveillance system to detect and report antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP includes strategies for infection prevention and control in healthcare services.
The NAP aligns with international standards and guidelines for antimicrobial resistance control.
The NAP includes actions to formulate guidelines for the rational use of antimicrobial drugs.
The NAP includes actions to formulate new practical laws and regulations for the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP promotes international collaboration for conducting research on antimicrobial resistance.
